Considering the TiO - PO base structure and Li + ions wandering around , oxygen atoms on PO tetrahedra will have a higher partial negative charge due to the high electronegativity difference between oxygen and phosphorus atoms .

Such a higher partial negative charge on oxygen atoms will create higher columbic force between oxygen and lithium ions ; that is to say , lithium ions will be pulled strongly in the framework which will inevitably restrict the free movement of lithium ions .

Considering the TiO - PO base structure and Li + ions wandering around , oxygen atoms on PO tetrahedra will have a higher partial negative charge due to the high electronegativity difference between oxygen and phosphorus atoms .

Considering the TiO - PO base structure and Li + ions wandering around , oxygen atoms on PO tetrahedra will have a higher partial negative charge due to the high electronegativity difference between oxygen and phosphorus atoms .

Such a higher partial negative charge on oxygen atoms will create higher columbic force between oxygen and lithium ions ; that is to say , lithium ions will be pulled strongly in the framework which will inevitably restrict the free movement of lithium ions .
